Find all episodes here, to follow and listen on your player of choice.

content.html:
A case of make your mind up Lachlan?

“I Think Lachlan’s Trying to Peter Thiel Crikey”

“(Crikey) finds it ‘mind-blowing’ that Lachlan is pursing a lawsuit that could, if successful, make it even harder for Australian news organizations, including all of News Corp’s Australian news organizations, to defend themselves against defamation claims.”

and then

“After Lachlan appears at Crikey’s defamation trial in March he will then fly to the US for the Dominion trial, set for April, in which Fox’s lawyers will argue vigorously for free speech. “

“That’s the key point of the hypocrisy,” said Mayne, who still contributes to Crikey but hasn’t been on staff since he sold it. (He’s also an activist News Corp shareholder.) “Being so precious in Australia while running a free speech defense against blatantly outrageous speech.”
content.value:
A case of make your mind up Lachlan?
“I Think Lachlan’s Trying to Peter Thiel Crikey”
“(Crikey) finds it ‘mind-blowing’ that Lachlan is pursing a lawsuit that could, if successful, make it even harder for Australian news organizations, including all of News Corp’s Australian news organizations, to defend themselves against defamation claims.”
and then
“After Lachlan appears at Crikey’s defamation trial in March he will then fly to the US for the Dominion trial, set for April, in which Fox’s lawyers will argue vigorously for free speech. “

“That’s the key point of the hypocrisy,” said Mayne, who still contributes to Crikey but hasn’t been on staff since he sold it. (He’s also an activist News Corp shareholder.) “Being so precious in Australia while running a free speech defense against blatantly outrageous speech.”

content.html:
I have played around with Dall-E 2 and Midjourney - in a highly amateur way … and really interested where it is all heading - questions abound as to whether this is the end of graphic designers (NO). This piece from Simon Bernes caught my eye : DALL·E 2 vs $10 Fiverr Commissions

Bottom line, AI delivers less than a $10 commission …. at least for now.
content.value:

content.html:
We usually share lists of ‘goodness’ - things like best albums, great movies and don’t miss books.

This list from @numericcitizen is a little different …tech stuff that for a variety of reasons he hasn’t stuck with.

Much agreement from this corner of the world.

content.html:
GAAAAAAAH

File under ‘Lessons for Posterity’

Just running through a podcast recording I did earlier this week. I didn’t use my own Zoom account and forgot to check that the account I was using was set to record separate audio tracks for each participant …

DOUBLE GAAAAAAAH!

content.html:
“Some napkin math told us that getting people to buy a $20 book is way less advantageous than getting a small percentage of those free readers to subscribe to our newsletter for $200/year.”

A big fan of Chris Lochhead and his category thinking .. this from a substack newsletter that is exploring what different people are doing to grow their business.
content.value:
“Some napkin math told us that getting people to buy a $20 book is way less advantageous than getting a small percentage of those free readers to subscribe to our newsletter for $200/year.”

A big fan of Chris Lochhead and his category thinking .. this from a substack newsletter that is exploring what different people are doing to grow their business.

content.html:
John Naughton

Churchill was witty in his public disparagement of him. (E.g. “A modest man with much to be modest about.” “An empty taxi drew up and Clement Attlee got out.”) But he knew better than anyone what a formidable operator Attlee was.

He then references a limerick which is sometimes attributed to Churchill.

There were few who thought him a starter,
And many who thought themselves smarter.
But he ended up PM, CH and OM,
An Earl and a Knight of the Garter.

And then goes on ….

It’s not inconceivable that people might write about Keir Starmer in these terms in a century from now. We shall just have to wait and see.

Umm - really? I’m not seeing it … yet. (John does provide a suitable waiting period!).

… then again - as much as I am not an artist, neither am I a political historian.
content.value:

An Earl and a Knight of the Garter.

It’s not inconceivable that people might write about Keir Starmer in these terms in a century from now. We shall just have to wait and see.

Umm - really? I’m not seeing it … yet. (John does provide a suitable waiting period!).
… then again - as much as I am not an artist, neither am I a political historian.

content.html:
I always liked Rackham’s art since I was introduced to it as a teenager.

Peter Pan in Kensington Gardens is a lovely - gorgeously illustrated piece containing this gem.

“A year later, Rackham would revolutionize the technology and economics of book art with his Alice in Wonderland illustrations; Peter Pan became the R&D lab for his revolution, working within the limitations of the three-color printing process then available to create worlds of wonder with his meticulous ink lines, populating London’s familiar landscapes and places with otherworldly creatures of haunting tenderness and strangeness — Shakespearean fairies and talking mice and, of course, his signature enchanted trees.”

I never really thought that about someone like Rackham revolutionizing technology … and having a ‘lab’ - but that’s my ignorance and lack of understanding of the process of art. Makes total sense.
content.value:

Peter Pan in Kensington Gardens is a lovely - gorgeously illustrated piece containing this gem.

“A year later, Rackham would revolutionize the technology and economics of book art with his Alice in Wonderland illustrations; Peter Pan became the R&D lab for his revolution, working within the limitations of the three-color printing process then available to create worlds of wonder with his meticulous ink lines, populating London’s familiar landscapes and places with otherworldly creatures of haunting tenderness and strangeness — Shakespearean fairies and talking mice and, of course, his signature enchanted trees.”

I never really thought that about someone like Rackham revolutionizing technology … and having a ‘lab’ - but that’s my ignorance and lack of understanding of the process of art. Makes total sense.
